sn22.91:1: At Sāvatthī.[n.84] This sutta and the next are identical with8:2–22and22:7–72.Then the Venerable Rahula approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side,sn.iii.36and said to him:
sn22.91:2: "Any kind of form whatsoever, Rahula, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near—one sees all form as it really is with correct wisdom thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self.’
